identificationModule.briefTitle: Effects of Common Meals on Appetite and Satiety
identificationModule.officialTitle: Back to the Basics: Metabolic and Appetitive Characteristics of Meals

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The objectives of this study are to assess the impacts of meals composed of lean steak and potatoes (with a small portion of broccoli) in comparison to other common entrée/starch food combinations on metabolic and appetite responses.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The objectives of this study are to utilize a novel, ecologically sound approach to assess the acute impacts of meals composed of lean steak and potatoes to other common entrée/starch food/vegetable combinations on metabolic and appetitive responses. Appetitive responses will serve as the primary outcome. Combinations for comparison will include lentil and sweet potato chili, macaroni and cheese, fish tacos, chicken and pea fried rice, pita and hummus, and creamy pork pasta.

armGroups.label: Arm 1 (lean steak and potatoes)
armGroups.description: lean steak and potatoes will be provided to subjects and primary and secondary outcomes will be measured at timelines explained under primary and secondary outcome measures.

armGroups.label: Arm 2 (lentil and sweet potato chili )
armGroups.description: lentil and sweet potato chili will be provided to subjects and primary and secondary outcomes will be measured at timelines explained under primary and secondary outcome measures.

armGroups.description: macaroni and cheese will be provided to subjects and primary and secondary outcomes will be measured at timelines explained under primary and secondary outcome measures.

armGroups.label: Arm 4 (fish tacos)
armGroups.description: fish tacos will be provided to subjects and primary and secondary outcomes will be measured at timelines explained under primary and secondary outcome measures.

armGroups.label: Arm 5 (chicken and pea fried rice)
armGroups.description: chicken and pea fried rice will be provided to subjects and primary and secondary outcomes will be measured at timelines explained under primary and secondary outcome measures.

armGroups.label: Arm 6 (pita and hummus)
armGroups.description: pita and hummus will be provided to subjects and primary and secondary outcomes will be measured at timelines explained under primary and secondary outcome measures.

armGroups.description: creamy pork pasta will be provided to subjects and primary and secondary outcomes will be measured at timelines explained under primary and secondary outcome measures.

interventions.name: Food items
interventions.description: Participants will be fed \~400 kcal palatable meals on separate occasions to test for changes in blood glucose and insulin levels as well as appetite over a 4-hour period of time.

primaryOutcomes.description: Using 100 mm visual analog scales (score from 0 to 100 and higher score means more)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline (B), 15 minutes from B, 30 minutes from B, 45 minutes from B, 60 minutes from B, 90 minutes from B, 120 minutes from B, 150 minutes from B, 180 minutes from B, 210 minutes from B, 240 minutes from B

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline (B), 15 minutes from B, 30 minutes from B, 45 minutes from B, 60 minutes from B, 90 minutes from B, 120 minutes from B, 150 minutes from B, 180 minutes from B, 210 minutes from B, 240 minutes from B

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* ages of 18-50 years
* BMI between 18-26

Exclusion Criteria:

* special dietary needs (e.g., gluten-free, etc.),
* 5% weight change in the previous 2 months,
* smoking, and substance use.
